sn35.237:3.1: 237 The Simile of Hands and Feet (2)
sn35.237:4.1: “Mendicants, when there are hands, there’s picking up and putting down.
sn35.237:4.2: When there are feet, there’s coming and going.
sn35.237:4.3: When there are joints, there’s contracting and extending.
sn35.237:4.4: When there’s a belly, there’s hunger and thirst.
sn35.237:4.5: In the same way, when there’s an eye, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.237:4.6: When there’s an ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.237:4.7: mind, pleasure and pain arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.237:5.1: When there are no hands, there’s no picking up and putting down.
sn35.237:5.2: When there are no feet, there’s no coming and going.
sn35.237:5.3: When there are no joints, there’s no contracting and extending.
sn35.237:5.4: When there’s no belly, there’s no hunger and thirst.
sn35.237:5.5: In the same way, when there’s no eye, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by eye contact.
sn35.237:5.6: When there’s no ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.237:5.7: mind, pleasure and pain don’t arise internally conditioned by eye contact.”
